docs.title: FTP Calculator Documentation
docs.text: A comprehensive Funds Transfer Pricing (FTP) calculation library with Rust core, Python bindings, and Excel integration.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• High Performance: Rust-powered calculations
  • Multi-language Support: Python and Excel interfaces
  • Advanced Methods: Stock and flux calculation methods
  • Production Ready: Comprehensive testing and CI/CD

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text: cc - Installation Guide - Python API Reference - Excel Add-In Guide - Rust Core Documentation

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/ce-teuf/FTP_CALCULATOR
cd FTP_CALCULATOR
make setup

docs.title: About
docs.text: xxxtbv

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This guide explains how to install and configure FTP_CALCULATOR for Rust, Python, and Excel.

docs.title: For all environments
docs.text:
• Git: To clone the repository. 
    sudo apt install git  # Linux (Debian/Ubuntu)
  • Rust: To compile the crates. 
    curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.2 -sSf https://sh.rustup.rs | sh
source $HOME/.cargo/env

docs.title: For Rust and Python
docs.text:
• Python 3.8+: 
    sudo apt install python3 python3-pip  # Linux
  • Build tools: 
    sudo apt install build-essential  # Linux

docs.title: For Excel (Windows only)
docs.text:
• .NET SDK 6.0: Download from dotnet.microsoft.com.
  • Excel 2016 or later (for the add-in).

docs.title: 1. Clone the repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/ton_org/FTP_CALCULATOR.git
cd FTP_CALCULATOR

docs.title: 2. Install Rust dependencies
docs.text: cargo install cbindgen  # To generate C headers

docs.title: 3. Install Python dependencies
docs.text: pip install -r python/requirements.txt

docs.title: For Python (PyO3)
docs.text:
cd crates/ftp_core_bindings_pyo3
maturin develop  # Installs the Python module locally

docs.title: For Excel (C)
docs.text:
cd crates/ftp_core_bindings_c
cargo build --release

docs.title: 5. Configure the Excel add-in (Windows)
docs.text:
1. Compile the C# project: 
    cd excel/AddIn
dotnet build

  2. Copy the .xll file:

    • The TonAddIn.xll file is generated in excel/AddIn/bin/Debug/.
    • Copy it to an accessible folder (e.g., ~/Desktop/).

  3. Load in Excel:

    • Open Excel.
    • Go to File > Options > Add-ins > Browse.
    • Select TonAddIn.xll.

docs.title: Verification
docs.text:
• Test the Python bindings: 
    python -c "from ftp_core_python import add; print(add(2, 3))"  # Should display 5
  • Test the Excel add-in: In an Excel cell, type: 
    =RustAdd(2, 3)  # Should return 5

docs.title: Quickstart
docs.text: Get started quickly with FTP_CALCULATOR in Rust, Python, and Excel.

docs.title: 1. Import the module
docs.text: from ftp_core_python import add, safe_divide

docs.title: 2. Use the functions
docs.text:
# Addition
result = add(10, 20)
print(result)  # Prints 30

# Safe division
result = safe_divide(10, 2)
print(result)  # Prints 5

# Error handling
result = safe_divide(10, 0)
print(result)  # Prints -1 (error)

docs.title: 3. Advanced example
docs.text:
from ftp_core_python import MonWrapper

wrapper = MonWrapper()
print(wrapper.fonction_etendue(5))  # Prints 15 (5 + 10)

docs.title: 1. Load the add-in
docs.text: • Open Excel and load TonAddIn.xll (see Installation).

docs.title: 2. Use the functions
docs.text: Excel Function Description Example =RustAdd(a, b) Adds two integers. =RustAdd(2, 3) =RustDivide(a, b) Divides two integers. =RustDivide(10, 2)

docs.title: 3. Example
docs.text:
=RustAdd(5, 7)       # Returns 12
=RustDivide(100, 4)  # Returns 25
=RustDivide(10, 0)   # Returns #DIV/0!

docs.title: 1. Add ftp_core as a dependency
docs.text:
In your Cargo.toml: 

[dependencies]
ftp_core = { path = "../FTP_CALCULATOR/crates/core" }

docs.title: 2. Use the functions
docs.text:
use ftp_core::add;

fn main() {
    let result = add(2, 3);
    println!("{}", result);  # Prints 5
}

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Read the technical documentation.
  • Explore Excel tutorials. ```

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Windows (Excel-DNA does not natively support Linux/macOS).
  • .NET SDK 6.0 installed.

docs.title: 1. Compile the add-in
docs.text:
cd excel/AddIn
dotnet build --configuration Release

docs.title: 2. Install the .xll file
docs.text:
1. Copy excel/AddIn/bin/Release/TonAddIn.xll to an accessible folder.
  2. In Excel:
    • Go to File > Options > Add-ins > Browse.
    • Select TonAddIn.xll.

docs.title: 3. Verify the installation
docs.text:
• A new category "Ton Add-In" appears in Excel functions.
  • Test with: 
    =RustAdd(1, 1)  # Should return 2

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text: Issue Solution .xll not loading Check the architecture (64-bit). Function not found Ensure ftp_core_bindings_c.dll is in excel/Interop/. ```

docs.title: Available Functions
docs.text: Function Description Excel Syntax RustAdd Adds two integers. =RustAdd(a, b) RustDivide Divides two integers. =RustDivide(a, b) RustGreet Returns a personalized message. =RustGreet("Name")

docs.title: 1. Series calculations
docs.text: =RustAdd(A1, B1)  # Adds the values of cells A1 and B1

docs.title: 2. Error handling
docs.text: =IFERROR(RustDivide(A1, B1), "Division error")

docs.title: 3. Integration with other formulas
docs.text: =SUM(RustAdd(A1, B1), RustAdd(C1, D1))  # Sum of two additions
